file.title: Declaring an Array
file.bullet: In JavaScript, arrays are denoted by square brackets, [ ]. The items in an array are called elements, and are separated by commas.

Like the other data types we have seen, arrays can be stored in variables.
var shapes = ['square', 'rectangle', 'circle', 'triangle'];
While there are other methods, the use of square brackets is the most common way to create an array in JavaScript.

To find out how many items are in an array, you can use the length property. Here is an example:
var shapes = ['square', 'rectangle', 'circle', 'triangle']; console.log(shapes.length); // 4
